intro: Scabiosa stellata var. monspeliensis, commonly known as the sweet William or garden scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
